skill.name: tool-discovery
skill.description: Recommend the right agents and skills for any task. Covers both heavyweight agents (Task tool) and lightweight skills (Skill tool). Triggers on: which agent, which skill, what tool should I use, help me choose, recommend agent, find the right tool.

skill.author: 0xDarkMatter

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation. No executable code, no network calls, no file access beyond allowed Read/Glob tools, no external commands, and no environment variable access. The skill provides recommendations for when to use agents vs skills.

content.value_statement: Choosing between agents and skills can be confusing. This skill provides clear recommendations for which agent or skill to use based on your task description, including decision flows and quick reference tables.
actual_capabilities: Recommend the right skill for reference and lookup tasks
Recommend the right agent for complex reasoning and decisions
Provide decision flowchart for skill vs agent selection
Offer quick reference tables for common development tasks
Match tasks to appropriate tools by file type and complexity
Link to detailed catalogs for skills and agents
limitations: Does not execute code or perform development tasks directly
Only recommends tools; does not install or configure them
Requires user to invoke the recommended skill or agent separately
Cannot access external resources or API documentation

use_cases.title: Learn tool selection
use_cases.description: Understand when to use skills for patterns vs agents for complex decisions

use_cases.title: Quick tool lookup
use_cases.description: Find the right specialized agent or skill without searching documentation

use_cases.title: Match task to tool
use_cases.description: Select the best tool for specific file types and development workflows

prompt_templates.title: Simple skill request
prompt_templates.prompt: Which skill should I use to look up SQL window function syntax?

prompt_templates.title: Agent selection
prompt_templates.prompt: I need help optimizing a slow database query in my Python application. Which agent should I use?

prompt_templates.title: Tool comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Should I use a skill or an agent to find all Python files in my project that use async?

prompt_templates.title: Framework expert
prompt_templates.prompt: Which expert agent can help me design a React hooks architecture for state management?

output_examples.input: Which tool should I use to find all files containing 'TODO' comments in my TypeScript project?
output: This is a pattern/reference task best handled by a lightweight skill.
The skill covers: fd (find by name), ripgrep (search contents), fzf (fuzzy selection)

best_practices: Use skills for quick lookups like syntax patterns and reference information
Use agents for complex tasks requiring reasoning and architectural decisions
Limit recommendations to 2-3 tools per task to avoid overwhelming users
Check the catalogs for complete agent and skill listings before recommending
anti_patterns: Recommending an agent for simple pattern lookups that a skill could handle
Suggesting skills for complex multi-step reasoning tasks
Over-recommending tools when one would suffice
Ignoring the complexity level when selecting between skills and agents

faq.question: What is the difference between a skill and an agent?
faq.answer: Skills are lightweight for patterns and references. Agents are heavyweight for complex reasoning and decisions.

faq.question: How do I invoke a recommended skill?
faq.answer: Use the Skill tool with skill: "skill-name". Example: Skill tool ‚Üí skill: "file-search"

faq.question: How do I invoke a recommended agent?
faq.answer: Use the Task tool with subagent_type: "agent-name" and prompt: "Your task description".

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides recommendations. It does not access files, networks, or execute code.

faq.question: Can this skill install tools for me?
faq.answer: No. The skill only recommends which tool to use. You need to install and configure tools separately.

faq.question: How does this compare to the Explore agent?
faq.answer: Explore finds code in your project. Tool Discovery recommends which agent or skill to use for a given task.
